reason: DROUGHT in Central Highlands: 33.3mm (BULLISH, FLOWERING stage)

payload.summary: The White House officially nominated Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as Federal Reserve Chair on February 24, 2026. Dubbed the 'Warsh Shock,' the move signals an aggressive pivot toward monetary discipline and active balance sheet reduction ('QT-for-cuts') starting in mid-2026.
payload.market_impact: The nomination triggered a 'bear steepening' of the yield curve with surging 10-year Treasury yields. This hawkish shift is expected to bolster the USD while placing downward pressure on commodities like gold due to higher projected real interest rates and the withdrawal of the Fed's market liquidity net.
